    Contact

    Oakland NLP Lab is always looking for motivated and talented researchers to join our team every semester. Please feel free to reach out if you want more information about the lab or if you're interested in doing NLP research at Oakland University.

    Prospective PhD Students

    If you are a current OU student or have been admitted in the university, please share the following details with Dr.Wilson:

    • A copy of your CV / an updated resume
    • Your university level transcripts (Undergraduate and Masters)
    • Background experience relevant to the field of Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning and Deep Learning(including statistics, mathematics and general programming experience).
    • A small statement on
      • Your research interests
      • Your motivation for choosing a PhD and your field of interest.
      • Why do you want to work in our lab
      • A very brief project proposal (if you have any in mind)
    • GRE or TOEFL scores (for international students)
    • A list of references (their names, titles, organizations and how you know them)
    • Any other documents or resources that may help you communicate your background effectively (for eg: website page, updated Google Scholar page, GitHub, videos of projects/presentations, code snippets etc.)

    If you're not currently a student at OU, the best way is to apply directly to the CS graduate program and mention you are interested in NLP in your application.

    Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience in the field of NLP and an established track record of publications in top conferences and workshops is a plus. Students with strong mathematical background and programming skills with adequate knowledge in the fields of (not limited to) machine learning, computational social science, deep learning, social media analysis, natural language processing etc. More importantly, a team player who can also perform tasks individually with a curiosity to learn more and a desire to conduct research is whom we are looking for 😀

    Undergraduate students

    We highly encourage that you take atleast one of the following courses or similar (CSI 6160, CSI 5130, CSI 5140, CSI 5340) before working in the lab. If interested, please send us your updated resume and transcripts via email.
